column4: should i post my question again and again to get help? (<= i know that is so lame :P)
just ask your question and wait till somoene can answer
i dont think that anyone would scroll up again :P
then either no one saw it, or no one knows the answer
ok, so your gnome keeps crashing?
this is going to seem a little assinine, but i suggest doing sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop
sometimes things don't get loaded or installed correctly
sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop <- that would be reinstall?
no, it'll make sure all the required packages are installed, and will get anything that might be missing
where should i type it? in recovery root mode?
are you in terminal, or in an x window session?
ctrl alt f2 should bring you to s screen you can log into the command line and do that ;)
